title: Top NFL Draft prospect Fernando Mendoza enthralled by possibility of Tom Brady mentorship: ‘It would mean so much’
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Fernando Mendoza, top 2026 NFL Draft prospect, is eager to learn from Tom Brady if drafted by the Las Vegas Raiders.
Mendoza, a College Football Playoff National Champion and Heisman winner, had an outstanding season with 3,535 yards and 41 touchdowns.
Despite being a potential first overall pick, Mendoza expressed humility, valuing any draft opportunity from any NFL team.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Kiss of the Spider Woman' starring Jennifer Lopez streams on Hulu, adapted from the Tony Award-winning musical.
'Paul McCartney: Man on the Run', a Beatles documentary by Morgan Neville, is available on Prime Video.
'Bridgerton' Season 4 (Part 2) highlighting Benedict's storyline is now streaming on Netflix.

title: Red Sox’ Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela say they’re fine after outfield collision
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela both remained in the game after colliding during a spring training matchup against the Braves.
The collision occurred while the two outfielders were chasing a fly ball in the first inning of Friday's game.
Despite the collision, Anthony and Rafaela both recorded hits off ex-Red Sox pitcher Chris Sale later in the game.

title: Alex Cora to donate $20K to Jimmy Fund when 2026 Red Sox hit this milestone
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora pledges $20,000 to the Jimmy Fund if a player hits 20 home runs.
Cora announced the donation plan on WEEI's 'The Greg Hill Show', betting on the team's power potential.
Past contributions include donating per Red Sox win and auctioning a photo wall from the 2018 season.

title: N.H. House advances bill targeting ‘indoctrination’ in public schools
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: The New Hampshire House passed the CHARLIE Act to regulate teaching on race, history, and LGBTQ+ topics in schools.
House Bill 1792 prohibits teaching critical race theory and promotes a patriotic educational approach, passing 184–164 in the House.
Teachers violating the CHARLIE Act risk disciplinary actions, and individuals may sue schools for up to $10,000 per violation.

title: The story behind these colorful icicles in the Berkshires
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Colorful icicles on Route 2 in North Adams are created with food coloring by local tradition.
The tradition of coloring ice at the Hairpin Turn spans decades, involving water balloons and supersoakers.
The scenic Hairpin Turn, built in 1914, offers panoramic views and is near the MASS MoCA art museum.

title: Mass. reports first two measles cases of 2026, including one in Greater Boston
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Massachusetts reports first two measles cases of 2026: a child diagnosed out-of-state and an adult in Greater Boston.
The Greater Boston adult recently returned from abroad with uncertain vaccination history and visited multiple locations while infectious.
Health officials emphasize high vaccination rates as key protection, with no exposure from the child in Massachusetts.

title: Local obituary: Morgan Mallard-Vitiello, 33, lifelong South Boston resident and mother of 2
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Morgan Mallard-Vitiello, a lifelong South Boston resident, passed away at 33 after a brief illness on February 21, 2026.
Morgan is survived by her husband Francis Vitiello, their children Mya and Frankie, and numerous family members and friends.
Memorial services are scheduled for March 3 and 4 in Dedham, with donations suggested to South Boston Special Kids & Young Adults.

title: She’s running Boston for The ALS Association in memory of her dad
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Lauren Hamilton, 26, from Tampa, Florida, will run the 2026 Boston Marathon in memory of her late father.
Hamilton honors her father, who passed away from ALS, by supporting the ALS Association through her marathon run.
Hamilton's participation highlights her hope for advancements in ALS treatments and honors her father's connection to Boston.

title: DiZoglio files emergency motion after AG Campbell moves to strike down audit lawsuit
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: State Auditor Diana DiZoglio filed an emergency motion to respond to AG Andrea Campbell's attempt to strike down an audit lawsuit.
DiZoglio's lawsuit seeks to compel Massachusetts legislative leaders to comply with an audit approved by nearly 72% of voters.
AG Campbell argues against the lawsuit, citing her role as 'gatekeeper' and questioning DiZoglio's authority to initiate legal action.
